data.title: SeqPrep
data.description: Tool for stripping adaptors and/or merging paired reads with overlap into single reads.
data.name: SeqPrep

evidence: README mentions binaries/installers: "NOTE 2: If the quality strings in the output contain characters less than ascii 33 on an ascii table (they look like lines from a binary file), try running again with or without the -6 option."

"SeqPrep is a program to merge paired end Illumina reads that are overlapping into a single longer read. It may also just be used for its adapter trimming feature" (end-user command-line tool for read processing).
Usage section shows direct execution: "./SeqPrep [Required Args] [Options]" with FASTQ inputs and outputs, indicating it directly processes sequencing data used in research analyses.
